intro: Paracalyx somalorum, commonly known as the Somali paracalyx, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and semi-arid habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
